results.body:
CARACAS, Venezuela -- Mariana Jimenez, a 20-year-old social communications student, has been crowned as the new Miss Venezuela, surpassing 24 other contestants and winning the right to represent Venezuela in the Miss Universe pageant.

As in recent years, the country's hard economic times were apparent in Thursday night's austere ceremony. The show went on without the international pop stars and Broadway-like dance productions that used to grace the competition. And it was held in the small studio of the show's sponsor rather than a large arena.

What hasn't changed is Venezuela's obsession with beauty. The show is one of the most-watched on Venezuelan TV and one that crosses political and class lines normally insurmountable after 15 years of socialist rule.

Venezuela has won more international beauty competitions than any other nation, including three of the last six Miss Universe pageants.

The current Miss Universe, Maria Gabriela Isler, who is Venezuelan, attended Thursday's pageant.
results.title: Miss Venezuela pageant reflects hard times

results.title: A new Miss Venezuela crowned in austere pageant that reflects nation's hard economic times

results.body:
ACUSHNET -- Faith Richard, newly crowned Miss Apple Peach 2014, is not your typical pageant girl. The Fairhaven High School senior is more sporty than dainty, and you'll find her wearing basketball sneakers and shorts far more than heels and dresses. Nonetheless, Richard entered the annual town pageant anyway and was pleasantly surprised at what she found.

"I'm known as the athletic type," Richard said in an interview over coffee on Saturday. "So I figured I'd just kind of give it a shot."

Born and raised in Acushnet, Richard didn't grow up dreaming of the coveted crown and title, but she had watched several cousins and family friends participate in the pageant over the years.

"I've always known about it, but I never really thought that I was going to enter in the pageant and be a part of it myself," she said.

When asked why she did enter the pageant so unexpectedly, Richard's adventurous side comes to life. With a smile, she explained that since it was the beginning of her senior year and her last chance to be eligible to participate in the pageant, she just felt like stepping outside of her comfort zone and trying something new and totally different from her typical self.

"It was a great experience. For people like me, it's a way to meet new people and step outside of your comfort zone. [In a pageant,] you do things that you don't do everyday. That's why it's important," said Richard.

As a girl who spends most of her time in a world far from pageants, Richard admitted she liked the change of scenery. "It was fun to wear a dress," Richard said. "This was the second long dress I've ever worn."

On top of her year-long reign as Miss Apple Peach, Richard is spending her spare time doing normal senior-year activities -- playing volleyball, applying to college and patiently awaiting her beloved basketball season.

Though she is not your "typical" pageant girl, there is no lack of charm in Richard's personality. She admitted that she's excited to have opportunities to dress up in her role as Miss Apple Peach, but the real reason she's looking forward to the year ahead captures Richard's spirit perfectly.

"I think it'll bring me closer to the people in town, and I'm really excited for that," she said.
results.title: Miss Apple Peach more used to T-shirts than pageantry circuit

results.body:
CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Southern Miss

Juco pitcher commits to Eagles

Alabama Southern Community College right-handed pitcher Hayden Roberts has verbally committed to Southern Miss, the Hattiesburg American has confirmed.

Roberts appeared in 15 games as a freshman last season for Alabama Southern, making nine starts. He finished with a 4-2 record, four saves, a 2.24 earned run average and struck out 52 batters in 64.1 innings pitched.

The 6-foot, 170-pound Irvington, Ala., native is the fifth confirmed verbal commitment for the 2016 season.

Left-handed pitcher Stevie Powers, infielder Matthew Guidry, right-handed pitcher Nick Sandlin and infielder Tracy Hadley have also committed to Southern Miss.

Soccer continues C-USA slate on road

Southern Miss will play at Old Dominion and Charlotte this weekend.

The Southern Miss soccer team hits the road for a pair of Conference USA tilts this weekend as the Golden Eagles take on Old Dominion at 6 p.m. on Friday before concluding the weekend at Charlotte at noon on Sunday.

Southern Miss enters the weekend with a 5-6-2 overall record, including a 0-2-2 mark in C-USA play. Old Dominion is 3-6-3 overall with a 2-1-1 clip in the league. Heading into the weekend, Charlotte is 5-5-1 and 2-2-0 in C-USA play, but will play host to Louisiana Tech on Friday night before hosting the Golden Eagles on Sunday.

The Golden Eagles hold an impressive 4-1-2 record at home this season, but will look to improve on their 1-5-0 road mark.

Volleyball readies for North Texas, Marshall

The Southern Miss volleyball team gets ready for a pair of matches this weekend when North Texas and Marshall visit Reed Green Coliseum on Oct. 10 and Oct. 12, respectively.

The Golden Eagles meet the Mean Green at 7 p.m. in Reed Green Coliseum followed by a matchup with the Thundering Herd on Sunday at 12 p.m.

Live stats and video will be available for both matches online at SouthernMiss.com.

Southern Miss travels to Florida Atlantic (Oct. 17) and FIU (Oct. 19) next weekend for a pair of C-USA matches.

CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORERead or Share this story: http://hatne.ws/1vVHB7N
results.title: Local sports briefs

results.body:
Dear Miss Manners * When I was 22, several dear friends were kind enough to send gifts when I participated in a debutante ball. I thanked them all in person.

However, I am now 30 and have failed to send written notes. I feel terrible about this and have for years, but I am uncertain if sending notes at this stage would simply remind them of the insult.

Gentle Reader * Penning a few notes at the time would have been far less work than fretting about it for eight years, a fact of which you must now be aware. Miss Manners mentions this for the benefit of those who complain that their lives are too busy for gratitude.

While etiquette does not have a statute of limitations, your friends are unlikely still to be thinking about your omission. Sending thank-you letters now is more likely to frighten than to atone: Your friends will either worry about either your mental equilibrium or their own postal service.

That you are still worrying over your slip suggests that it has not recurred. The next time you express gratitude to one of these friends for a new gift, include a light-hearted reference to the original gift and mention that you still remember it with affection.

Dear Miss Manners * As a freshman at my dream university in another state, I want to notify close family members and friends of my change of address, but I'm unsure of how to do it.

I don't want to post the information freely on social media. My older relatives don't have Facebook anyway, I don't check my own account that often, and there is always a concern about privacy and safety.

I thought about sending short, personal notes including my new address and how excited I am about college, but a friend told me that the idea seemed "desperate" and like I was "begging for gifts and money."

I hadn't even thought of it that way, and I don't want to make anyone feel obligated to write to me or send me care packages. I just wanted to make sure they had the option if they wanted it. What is the best way to notify a change in address without seeming "grabby" for gifts?

Gentle Reader * Assure your friend that those in search of gifts are not so subtle as to disguise their request as a change of address notice. As Miss Manners is sadly aware, they specify the item -- or items -- they want, the store at which it is to be purchased, the amount the giver may expect to pay for it, the color and the delivery method.

And they rarely trouble to write personal notes to their targeted benefactors. That is what you could do, when you send your change of address.

Dear Miss Manners * I have now reached the age when service people find it amusing to say, "Can I help you, young man?" -- the joke being that I am obviously not a young man.

Would it be rude to reply by saying, "Yes, thank you, handsome" (or "beautiful")?

Gentle Reader * It took Miss Manners a minute to get this, and your service people may take it at face value. But she congratulates you on a comeback that meets her requirements of making your point without being rude.
results.title: Statute of limitations on a thank-you note

results.body:
Children and adults in the Boston area will have access to a brand-new dedicated gymnastics facility by the end of the year.

A new group called Boston Gymnastics Academy has been set up by two Kims - gymnast Kim Glasel and business partner Kim Hughes.

The pair have just secured a large premises in Butterwick - where they are investing thousands to provide the perfect site for gymnasts of all ages and abilities to use.

"Gymnastics has been a part of my life since I was seven," said Miss Glasel, 26. "I always wanted to be a gymnast but teachers at school used to say to me it's not a real job.

"I have always wanted to have my own club too - and there's the opportunity here now to go for it."

Miss Glasel, 26, has run satellite clubs at schools in the past and also teaches PE at St Thomas Primary School in Boston.

She and Kim Hughes currently work at a gymnastics club based at the PRSA.

The pair are investing more than £50,000 in the equipment alone for the new site, in School Lane.

Work began on the premises on Saturday, with the facility expected to open before Christmas.

"We are going to offer all classes from beginners through to competition standard," Miss Glasel explained.

"We can't offer pre-school classes - but we can have parent and child classes so they can come in and supervise them.

"We will be entering all the county and regional competitions - and will also offer some gym fit programmes which offer exercise classes."

Their academy will coach all different types of gymnastics but they are particularly keen to take the women's artistic side of gymnastics further. This is for girls who do bars and vaults.

Their dream has been helped along by the generosity of others - with partners and friends carrying out some of the work to the facility. Kim Hughes' husband, who is an electrician, doing all the necessary work, while Kim Glasel's partner Nathan, a carpenter, is making the benches for the changing rooms.

Miss Glasel added: "Everybody seems really pleased for us."
results.title: New academy to cater for Boston gymnasts

results.body:
Tia Wood dances during the international powwow at the Manito Ahbee Festival.

Two years ago, Tia Wood was on life support. Following a serious vehicle rollover in Montana, the Wood family, from Saddle Lake, found themselves separated as their youngest daughter was flown to the children's hospital in Seattle with multiple breaks all over her body, and collapsed lungs.

"We almost lost Tia. She was in a coma, she was in really bad shape," recalls Cynthia Jim-Wood, Tia's mom, as she begins the story that led the now 15-year-old to become this year's Miss Manito Ahbee Youth Ambassador.

On Sept. 13, Tia received the prestigious title while attending the Manito Ahbee Festival, in Manitoba.

"Manito Ahbee is one of the most important and significant traditional aboriginal gathering sites in all of Turtle Island (North America)," according to the event's official website.

Tia attended Manito Ahbee for the first time just three months after the accident that nearly took her life, and was in attendance when her sister Fawn Wood, won an Aboriginal People's Choice Music Award for Best Hand Drum Album in 2012.

"About three months (after the accident), so determined, she found herself on stage with her sister," says Cynthia, as she continues telling Tia's story. She says Tia was motivated by her sister's success to sing, despite her lungs being scarred.

There were "multiple ceremonies devoted to her health and wellness. It was like a miracle. She just got healthier faster," says the proud mom. Tia even found herself singing on stage with her sister at the music awards in 2012.

This year, the Wood family again found themselves at the Manito Ahbee Festival. The family would celebrate Fawn's fourth time being nominated at the awards, this time for a duet album with her partner Dallas Waskahat.

"It's been quite a blessed journey," says Fawn, as she speaks of her success. "It's not typical for a woman to be singing in this genre." Although she sang most of her life, it is within the last seven years that Fawn started writing and composing songs.

The family would also have a second reason to celebrate, as Tia was named Miss Manito Ahbee during the international powwow competition.

The process to become Miss Manito Ahbee involves interviews, gathering references, and a hand-written essay on the day of the event. Tia says she finished the essay with just minutes to spare.

The title of Miss Manito Ahbee holds a lot of significance, says Cynthia, because it honours the memory of missing and murdered aboriginal women. During the process of becoming Miss Manito Ahbee, Tia met with the family of the late Lorna Blacksmith, a 17-year-old aboriginal girl who went missing in January of 2012, and whose body was found in June of 2012.

During the next year, Tia will work with Blacksmith's family to create awareness about missing and murdered women.

"It was very emotional. You could tell they were still grieving," says Tia, as she quietly recalls her meeting with the family. A rather shy girl, Tia says she was "shocked, and excited, and happy," when she was named Miss Manito Ahbee.

Along with singing, Tia is also an old-style jingle dancer.

She says she hopes to "inspire young girls to get involved with their culture," which is something her older sister Fawn also aspires to do through her music.

Tia now has the responsibility to speak on behalf of the murdered and missing aboriginal women, whenever she gets the opportunity. She will speak at gatherings of all kinds over the next 12 months.

Cynthia says Tia will use her 12,000 fans on Facebook to help create awareness. Online, Tia has quite a large following of fans. Her name is easily searchable on YouTube, with one of her singing videos posted about a year ago garnering over 105,000 views.

Although most teenagers are still discovering who they are, Cynthia believes that because of her accident and cultural upbringing, Tia is much more aware of her identity. She describes her daughter are being accepting, patient, kind, thankful, and honest.

"That's what she brought to the table in her mannerisms," says Cynthia, adding, "It's the way she lives."

And although the 15-year-old has already achieved such success, she knows there is still a lot to learn in life. Her mom believes the Miss Manito Ahbee title will be a major "stepping stone" in her daughter's life.

"This is such a triumph for her," says Cynthia, adding, her daughter worked hard holistically to get her health back after the accident.

"We truly believe that our family is in ceremony all the time," says Cynthia, adding, the family has always attended powwows and a variety of ceremonies. The other Wood children are also following paths that demonstrate their strong cultural upbringing.

The family is made up of four daughters and one son. Their daughter Raven is currently travelling a powwow circuit in California, while another daughter, Naomi, is completing her masters in social work. Along with pursuing her musical talents, Fawn is furthering her post-secondary education as well. Their son, Wiser, just started a six-year program in clinical social work.

The importance of education is a crucial part of the Wood children's upbringing.

"That's our new buffalo," says Cynthia, as she explains that she and her husband realize education plays a key role in their family's success. Cynthia is also furthering her post-secondary education at the moment.

Both Earl and Cynthia are residential school survivors and Cynthia says it is their "cultural way of life" that has allowed them to thrive.

Going back to the moment Tia was named Miss Manito Ahbee, both Cynthia and Fawn describe the moment in similar terms.

"When they called her name, we were just 'oh my goodness', we just couldn't believe it," says Cynthia, with Fawn adding, "It was a very proud moment for all of us."

According to the festival's website, the Manito Ahbee site is located in the western Whiteshell area of Manitoba, and marks the location where the Creator makes his home. Manito Ahbee means, "Where the Creator sits."

The site is recognized by aboriginal peoples across North America as a sacred place for all people.
results.title: Local girl will honour missing women with Miss Manito Ahbee title

results.body:
La modelo y estudiante de Comunicación Social de 20 años Mariana Jiménez (i), Miss Venezuela 2014; posa junto a Miss Internacional, Edymar Martinez (d), durante su primera presentación a la prensa en Caracas. EFE

La Miss Venezuela 2014, Mariana Jiménez, dedicó hoy la corona que obtuvo ayer en el concurso de belleza venezolano a su colega Mónica Spear que fue asesinada en enero pasado junto a su esposo por una banda de criminales.

"Se la dedico a Mónica Spear, es para ti, nada más que decir, es para ti Mónica, te dedico esta corona y esta banda", dijo Jiménez durante la acostumbrada rueda de prensa que ofrecen las concursantes que lograron los tres primeros puestos en el Miss Venezuela.

La nueva reina respondió así a la pregunta sobre su opinión sobre el por qué durante el concurso no se recordó a Spear, que fue Miss Venezuela 2004 y después fue reconocida por su desempeño como actriz de telenovelas.

"Si ayer no se le rindió homenaje, hoy se lo brindo a ella porque este es un honor llevar su banda y esta corona se la dedico a ella. Es un honor, no tenemos palabras", reiteró.

Spear, de 29 años, y su esposo, el irlandés Thomas Henry Berry, de 39 años, murieron tiroteados por delincuentes el pasado 6 de enero en una carretera del centro del país mientras que la hija de 5 años de la pareja resultó herida.

Jiménez, que representará a su país en el concurso de Miss Universo también comentó que fue "una emoción increíble" sentir ayer la corona sobre su cabeza y que ahora tiene una responsabilidad "con Venezuela".

En la rueda de prensa también estuvieron presentes Mayra Rodríguez, coronada como Miss Tierra y Elymar Martínez, que irá al certamen Miss International.

Jiménez, modelo y estudiante de Comunicación Social se impuso a otras 25 candidatas en un vistoso evento celebrado en el canal privado Venevisión.
results.title: Nueva Miss Venezuela dedica su corona a su colega asesinada en enero pasado

results.body:

Spear, de 29 años, y su esposo, el irlandés Thomas Henry Berry, de 39 años, murieron tiroteados por delincuentes el pasado 6 de enero en una carretera del centro del país mientras que la hija de 5 años de la pareja resultó herida.

Jiménez, modelo y estudiante de Comunicación Social se impuso a otras 25 candidatas en un vistoso evento celebrado en el canal privado Venevisión. EFE

Leyenda de la imagen: CARACAS (VENEZUELA), 10/10/2014.- La modelo y estudiante de Comunicación Social de 20 años Mariana Jiménez, Miss Venezuela 2014; posa hoy viernes 10 de octubre de 2014, durante su primera presentación a la prensa en Caracas, Venezuela. Jiménez, fue elegida en la noche del jueves y representará a su país en el próximo certamen de Miss Universo, un evento internacional en el que las representantes venezolanas ya han conquistado siete coronas. EFE/José Rivera
results.title: Mariana jímenez dedicated his crown to monica spear

results.body:
Mariana Jiménez, una morena de 20 años y coronada como la nueva Miss Venezuela el viernes, dedicó su corona a la actriz y ex reina de belleza venezolana Mónica Spear, asesinada a balazos junto a su pareja en una autopista en enero.

"Es para ti Mónica, te dedico esta corona y esta banda", dijo mirando al cielo, la imponente joven de 1,80 metros de estatura y representante del estado Guárico (centro), en la tradicional rueda de prensa del día después del certamen.

Spear, de 29 años, y su compañero Thomas Henry Berry fueron asesinados a balazos a principios de enero en su vehículo tras una emboscada con fines de robo en la autopista Puerto Cabello-Valencia, un hecho que conmocionó a la opinión pública en uno de los países más violentos del mundo.

Junto a la nueva Miss Venezuela, Edymar Martínez, de 19 años y concursante por el estado Anzoátegui (noreste), representará a Venezuela en Miss Internacional, mientras Mayra Rodríguez, de 22 años y concursante por Amazonas (sur), participará en Miss Tierra.

El Miss Venezuela, un concurso cuyos orígenes se remontan a 1952, cuando comenzó como un artificio publicitario de la aerolínea Pan Am, se celebró en plena crisis económica, marcada por alta inflación y escasez de divisas.

Este año, el concurso se celebró de forma sencilla, lejos de las lujosas galas por las que fue conocido años atrás.

En esta edición, no se presentaron artistas ni animadores internacionales, y en lugar de celebrarse en el Poliedro de Caracas, con capacidad para 13.500 personas, fue grabado sin público en un estudio de la televisora privada Venevisión, dueña de los derechos de transmisión.

El certamen es una tradición en Venezuela, país con las mayores reservas mundiales de petróleo, que también es conocido en el mundo por su rigurosa preparación de reinas de belleza de la mano de Osmel Sousa, el llamado "Zar de la belleza".
results.title: Nueva Miss Venezuela dedica su corona a Mónica Spear

results.body:

Spear, de 29 aÃ±os, y su esposo, el irlandÃ©s Thomas Henry Berry, de 39 aÃ±os, murieron tiroteados por delincuentes el pasado 6 de enero en una carretera del centro del paÃ­s mientras que la hija de 5 aÃ±os de la pareja resultÃ³ herida.

results.title: Nueva Miss Venezuela dedica su corona a Mónica Spear

results.body:
Mariana Jiménez, una morena de 20 años proclamada Miss Venezuela el jueves, dedicó su corona a la actriz y ex reina de belleza venezolana Mónica Spear, asesinada a balazos junto a su pareja en una autopista en enero.

"Es para ti Mónica, te dedico esta corona y esta banda", dijo mirando al cielo, la imponente joven de 1,80 metros de estatura y representante del estado Guárico (centro), en la tradicional rueda de prensa del día después del certamen.

Spear, de 29 años, y su compañero Thomas Henry Berry fueron asesinados a balazos a principios de enero en su vehículo, tras una emboscada con fines de robo en la autopista Puerto Cabello-Valencia (norte), un hecho que conmocionó a la opinión pública en uno de los países más violentos del mundo.

Junto con la nueva Miss Venezuela, Edymar Martínez, de 19 años y concursante por el estado Anzoátegui (noreste), representará a Venezuela en Miss Internacional, mientras Mayra Rodríguez, de 22 años y concursante por Amazonas (sur), participará en Miss Tierra.

El Miss Venezuela, un concurso cuyos orígenes se remontan a 1952, cuando comenzó como un artificio publicitario de la aerolínea Pan Am, se celebró en plena crisis económica, marcada por alta inflación y escasez de divisas.

Este año, el certamen se celebró de forma sencilla, lejos de las lujosas galas por las que fue conocido años atrás.

En esta edición, no se presentaron artistas ni animadores internacionales y, en lugar de celebrarse en el Poliedro de Caracas, con capacidad para 13.500 personas, fue grabado sin público en un estudio de la televisora privada Venevisión, dueña de los derechos de transmisión.

El concurso es una tradición en Venezuela, país con las mayores reservas mundiales de petróleo y que también es conocido en el mundo por su rigurosa preparación de reinas de belleza de la mano de Osmel Sousa, el llamado "zar de la belleza".
results.title: La emotiva dedicatoria de la nueva Miss Venezuela

results.body:
CARACAS.- "Es para ti Mónica, te dedico esta corona y esta banda", dijo mirando al cielo, la imponente joven de 1,80 metros de estatura y representante del estado Guárico (centro), en la tradicional rueda de prensa del día después del certamen.

Spear, de 29 años, y su compañero Thomas Henry Berry fueron asesinados a balazos a principios de enero en su vehículo tras una emboscada con fines de robo en la autopista Puerto Cabello-Valencia (norte), un hecho que conmocionó a la opinión pública en uno de los países más violentos del mundo.

Junto a la nueva Miss Venezuela, Edymar Martínez, de 19 años y concursante por el estado Anzoátegui (noreste), representará a Venezuela en Miss Internacional, mientras Mayra Rodríguez, de 22 años y concursante por Amazonas (sur) , participará en Miss Tierra.

El Miss Venezuela, un concurso cuyos orígenes se remontan a 1952, cuando comenzó como un artificio publicitario de la aerolínea Pan Am, se celebró en plena crisis económica, marcada por alta inflación y escasez de divisas.

Este año, el concurso se celebró de forma sencilla, lejos de las lujosas galas por las que fue conocido años atrás.

En esta edición, no se presentaron artistas ni animadores internacionales, y en lugar de celebrarse en el Poliedro de Caracas, con capacidad para 13 mil 500 personas, fue grabado sin público en un estudio de la televisora privada Venevisión, dueña de los derechos de transmisión.

El certamen es una tradición en Venezuela, país con las mayores reserva mundiales de petróleo, que también es conocido en el mundo por su rigurosa preparación de reinas de belleza de la mano de Osmel Sousa, el llamado "Zar de la belleza".

De la mano de Souza, el país sudamericano ha logrado seis Miss Mundo, seis Miss Internacional y siete Miss Universo, incluida María Gabriela Isler, la actual monarca, que fue coronada en noviembre del 2013 en el Crocus City Hall de Moscú, Rusi
results.title: Nueva Miss Venezuela dedica su corona a exreina asesinada en enero

results.body:
Mariana JimĂŠnez, dedicĂł hoy la corona que obtuvo ayer en el concurso de belleza venezolano a su colega, quien fue asesinada en enero pasado junto a su esposo

La Miss Venezuela 2014, Mariana JimĂŠnez, dedicĂł hoy la corona que obtuvo ayer en el concurso de belleza venezolano a su colega MĂłnica Spear que fue asesinada en enero pasado junto a su esposo por una banda de criminales.

"Se la dedico a MĂłnica Spear, es para ti, nada mĂĄs que decir, es para ti MĂłnica, te dedico esta corona y esta banda" , dijo JimĂŠnez durante la acostumbrada rueda de prensa que ofrecen las concursantes que lograron los tres primeros puestos en el Miss Venezuela.

La nueva reina respondiĂł asĂ­ a la pregunta sobre su opiniĂłn sobre el por quĂŠ durante el concurso no se recordĂł a Spear, que fue Miss Venezuela 2004 y despuĂŠs fue reconocida por su desempeĂąo como actriz de telenovelas.

"Si ayer no se le rindiĂł homenaje, hoy se lo brindo a ella porque este es un honor llevar su banda y esta corona se la dedico a ella. Es un honor, no tenemos palabras" , reiterĂł.

Spear, de 29 aĂąos, y su esposo, el irlandĂŠs Thomas Henry Berry, de 39 aĂąos, murieron tiroteados por delincuentes el pasado 6 de enero en una carretera del centro del paĂ­s mientras que la hija de 5 aĂąos de la pareja resultĂł herida.

JimĂŠnez, que representarĂĄ a su paĂ­s en el concurso de Miss Universo tambiĂŠn comentĂł que fue "una emociĂłn increĂ­ble" sentir ayer la corona sobre su cabeza y que ahora tiene una responsabilidad "con Venezuela" .

En la rueda de prensa tambiĂŠn estuvieron presentes Mayra RodrĂ­guez, coronada como Miss Tierra y Elymar MartĂ­nez, que irĂĄ al certamen Miss International.

JimĂŠnez, modelo y estudiante de ComunicaciĂłn Social se impuso a otras 25 candidatas en un vistoso evento celebrado en el canal privado VenevisiĂłn.
results.title: Miss Venezuela dedica su corona a Mónica Spear

results.body: Mariana Jiménez, quien en representación del estado Guárico, fue coronada la noche de este jueves como la nueva Miss Venezuela 2014, dijo sentirse dichosa y dedico su triunfo a la fallecida reina de belleza Mónica Spear. "Si durante el certamen no se le rindió un tributo, hoy yo le dedico mi triunfo y es todo un honor para mí, llevar la misma banda que Mónica lució en el año 2004".
results.title: Mariana Jiménez dedicó su triunfo a Mónica Spear

results.body:
La cordobesa Valentina Ferrer ganó el título Miss Argentina 2014. La joven de 22 años oriunda de Carlos Paz, competirá por ser Miss Universo. Mirá alguna de sus producciones

Este jueves por la noche, Valentina Ferrer fue elegida Miss Universo Argentina 2014 en un desfile que se realizó en Buenos Aires bajo la conducción de Valeria Mazza.

La belleza, una chica oriunda de Carlos Paz, tiene 22 años, mide 1,78 y sus medidas son 90-60-91. Ferrer había obtenido el derecho de participar en la competencia nacional tras ganar el certamen provincial en Córdoba, el 17 de agosto pasado.

Las otras dos finalistas fueron la santafesina Mariana Manrique y la jujeña Pilar Jiménez, las que fueron elegidas por el jurado integrado por Benito Fernandez, Ricky Sarkany, Fabian Medina Flores y Marite Dejesus.

Según consigna La Voz, este sábado a las 22.30 en la pantalla de América se emitirá "Buscando a Miss Universo Argentina 2014", un programa especial en el que podrán ver imágenes del desfile y entrevistas.
results.title: Una cordobesa Miss Argentina para Miss Universo 2014 (video)

results.body:
Fernando Sánchez Vela Un reto a la inacción y al conformismo

La modelo y excandidata del Miss Ucayali 2014, Katia García confirmó hace unos días que participará en la elección del 'Miss Yarinacocha 2014', certamen de belleza organizado por la Municipalidad Distrital de Yarinacocha como parte de las actividades por el aniversario de ese populoso distrito, que además tendrá la participación de diferentes artistas musicales. Como no podíamos perder tiempo, rápidamente nos comunicamos con Katia y es de esta manera que conocimos más sobre su vida y sobre el nuevo reto que a sus cortos misteriosos años asume. "Entré a este concurso porque varios de mis amigos me animaron y porque sé que con mucho esfuerzo puedo lograrlo", dijo brevemente Katia, quien además mencionó que no se siente favorita en este concurso, pero sí espera que lo aprendido en el Miss Ucayali le sirva de mucho. "Creo que todas las chicas que están participando en este concurso tienen las cualidades suficientes para ser coronada como la reina de Yarinacocha. En este concurso hay chicas que tienen mucha más experiencia que yo, solo espero que todo lo aprendido en el Miss Ucayali me sirva en este concurso, si es así, estoy segura que podré lograrlo".

La también estudiante de administración habló sobre la relación que mantiene con el resto de candidatas. "Mi relación con el resto de chicas es muy buena, siempre estamos intercambiando ideas, conversando, nos llevamos muy bien. En ese grupo no existe la envidia, el rencor y cosas así". Según dijo, llegó a Pucallpa hace varios años atrás y que le encanta nuestra ciudad. Además, reveló que está próxima a licenciarse como administradora de empresas. "Pucallpa es una ciudad muy bella, yo llegué hace 6 años para estudiar y trabajar y siempre me han tratado bien, gracias a eso, dentro de poco me titularé", agregó la modelo, que al momento de despedirse invitó a la población en general a apoyarla en este concurso. "Solo me queda agradecer por la oportunidad y decirles a todos que no me dejen de apoyar en este concurso, estoy segura que daré lo mejor de mí".

DATO: El miércoles pasado, los miembros de la organización del evento en una conferencia de prensa realizada en el centro comercial Open Plaza, presentaron ante los diferentes medios de comunicación a las 10 candidatas que participarán en el mencionado certamen que tiene como fecha el sábado 11 de octubre dentro de los ambientes del coloso Campo Ferial de Yarinachocha a partir de las 8 de la noche. No faltar.
results.title: Katia García participará en el Miss Yarinacocha 2014

results.body:
Luciendo un sensual traje de diosa dorada, diseño con plumas y detalles en animal print, así lució Nicole Algarañaz a la hora de presentarse a la prensa de la farándula local, como la modelo que nos representará en el certamen internacional Miss Turismo y Cultura Universo 2014, a realizarse en Asunción del Paraguay, del 20 al 25 del presente mes

"Viajaré este domingo a Paraguay. Me objetivo es traerme la corona del del concurso", resaltó la esbelta y alta modelo,que partirá al vecino país llevando en su maleta diseños exclusivos alusivos a las diferentes culturas del país, expresado en un traje de gala, traje típico, y quince vestidos de cóctel.

Para saber. Nicole es dueña de una torneada figura (90-65-95) de 1,75 metros de estatura. Es la primera vez que participa en un certamen internacional después de dos años dedicados al mundo de las pasarelas.
results.title: Nicole será Bolivia en el Miss Turismo y Cultura Universo 2014
